page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: This area is mainly farmland.The main area of population is the village of Tattingstone with a population of about six hundred including the hospital patients. Most of the rest of the area has isolated farmhouses with tied cottages which are often very old e.g.Hubbard's Hall Farm dates back to the fifteenth century. Many houses in Tattingstone date back to Elizabethan times.Some of the cottages are thatched but many have had their thatch replaced with tiles.In 1948 12 council houses were built in Green Lane and later six more were built on Lemon's Hill.There are eight old age pensioners houses in Glebe Close.In the last few years many new expnsive detached houses and bungalows have been buillt e.g.in The Close.
